text: the aerial bombardment of the country by
Russian and Syrian government warplanes
is relentless this video apparently
showing an airstrike on a town south of
Aleppo
the man filming says it's the sixth time
they've been hit in recent days
and once again it is the innocence
paying the price
her name is aya she says her home was
attacked and she calls out for her
father where is my daddy
that the conflict in Syria has created
one of the worst humanitarian crises
since the Second World War is beyond
doubt according to the United Nations at
least 300,000 people have been killed
4.8 million have fled the country
becoming refugees while almost nine
million others have fled their homes for
safer parts of Syria in total that's
more than half the entire population
right now much of the heaviest fighting
is here in the northern city of Aleppo
in this the rebel-held area more than
250,000 people have been under siege for
weeks hospitals and water supplies
amongst the many targets systematically
bombed by Russian and regime planes
since the collapse of the tentative
ceasefire last month
many believe these amount to war crimes
including the MP behind today's
emergency debate in Parliament who says
Russia is acting like Nazi Germany first
of all we should single Russia out as a
pariah the Kremlin like any bully craves
relevance and is winning as long as no
one stands up to them Russia must be
confronted for its attacks on innocent
civilians confronted both diplomatically
and using hard pallas sanctions economic
measures and we must seek to build
support from multilateral military
action to discharge our responsibility
to protect many MPs from different
parties agreed with his idea of setting
up a no-fly zone to protect the Syrian
people
but in response the Foreign Secretary
warned it could have enormous
consequences
we cannot commit to a no-fly zone unless
we are prepared to confront and perhaps
as my honorable friend behind me has
already said we cannot do that unless we
are prepared to shoot down planes or
helicopters that violate that zone and
we need to think very carefully about
the consequences and Russia's showing no
sign of backing away from its
bombardment of eastern Aleppo it blames
the West for the breakdown of the recent
ceasefire here and seems determined to
help the Syrian regime take back all
this area from the rebels whatever the
cost
Richard Galpin BBC News
